name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Introduction to CTF Competitions
long_desc: Capture the flag CTF competitions are typically run every weekend by various teams, schools, and companies. They are full of challenges that typically fit into one of the main categories Binary ExploitationPwn, Reverse Engineering, Cryptography, Web, and Forensics. Theyre a gamified way to learn about new technologies and techniques actively being used in the cybersecurity field and can also be pretty fun

custom_fields.goals: Students will have more familiarity with the problems posed in these competitions and have the confidence to go into them and hit the ground running
custom_fields.key_topics: Reverse engineering, binary exploitation, cryptography, forensics, and web
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Basic Python, command line usage, and knowing how to create and use virtual machines
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Homework problems, writeups, quizzes, and attendance
custom_fields.relevance: Newer students can be intimidated by these competitions, so this will hopefully be a way to ease their way into it
custom_fields.learning_resources: The Internet, canvas, hints for homework problems, office hours, other students
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Homework assignments and possibly office hours
